newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks open higher, oil shares lead rise.
newsitem.headline: French stocks open higher, oil shares lead rise.

text.p: French stocks opened higher on Wednesday, helped by firmer bond prices and a higher close on Wall Street, brokers said.

Oil stocks Total and Elf-Aquitaine, which have risen on the back of higher oil prices, extended their gains after Total confirmed investor expectations of good results by reporting a 45 percent jump in its first-half profit.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was up 9.98 points, or 0.51 percent, at 1,981.41 at 0835 GMT, while the CAC-40 September futures contract was up 10 points at 1,987 where it has bumped into resistance.
Total was up 0.18 percent at 385.20 francs after easing from a high of 390.40. Elf, due to report its results on Thursday, was 0.84 percent higher at 385 francs.
